snippet: Strange as it might seem, N.F.L. players do not protect — in any way, apparently — perhaps their most sensitive possession.
abstract: NFL players, for various reasons, do not wear protective groin equipment; concern for players safety is rising, as there have been several high-profile incidents involving foot-to-groin contact.
lead_paragraph: Strange as it might seem, N.F.L. players do not protect — in any way, apparently — perhaps their most sensitive possession.

headline.seo: For Various Reasons, N.F.L. Players Do Not Wear Cups
headline.main: Helmet? Check. Shoulder Pads? Check. Cup? No Thanks.
headline.print_headline: Helmet? Check. Shoulder Pads? Check. Cup? No Thanks.
